intro: Vittadinia hispidula, commonly known as the hispid sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that resemble orchids. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands, often in regions with well-drained soils. Its hairy stems and leaves are adaptations to its arid or semi-arid environment. Vittadinia hispidula is an important component of local ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
